Subjective: Headache, worse on right side, sometimes everywhere; nausea, no vomiting; glare in vision; prefers dark room; worsens with noise and light. Impact: unable to play volleyball, scuba dive, or participate in social activities. Family history: father has migraines, grandfather had cluster headaches. No fever, no flashes of light, no vomiting. Worried about cause and best course of action.
Objective: BP 120/80; pulse 50/min; cranial nerves fine; fingertip-nose test good; arm and leg strength good; Romberg's normal. Neurological examination normal.
Assessment: Migraine, possible; cluster headache, unlikely. No signs of serious conditions.
Plan: Start pain relief (paracetamol, ibuprofen) as soon as symptoms start
Keep headache diary to track symptoms and identify patterns
Return in 4 weeks for follow-up, or sooner if symptoms worsen or change
